Articles.Content: You know that you don't need to use symmetry while placing Soyuz/Progress panels? They look better facing the same way. Also, Kristall did have solar panels at launch. One was later moved to Kvant, the other was folded. Priroda didn't, though, and they almost lost it because of that.
I forgot that Soyuz panels are fixed lol, btw any thoughts on the other station? Its primarily nuclear powered, with solar panels for back-up
how do you fly the kipler? l lose control really fast once the rocket starts to wobble

Here is Progress departing from the now complete (though without docking module) Mir, apologies for putting solar panels on Priordia and Kristall, but they wouldnt have made it to the station without some way of generating the leckie.

-snip-

I've never had problems docking modules to Mir without solar panels. Perhaps you should time your launches so that you rendezvous at roughly the same time you reach orbit.

how do you fly the kipler? l lose control really fast once the rocket starts to wobble

Turn on SAS and let it fly itself, and allow it to wobble. Whne you reach 15 kilometers, roll the rocket so that you can gravity turn with the kliper being on its back. Be sure to activate RCS before starting your gravity turn, as it can otherwise result in much pain. No, you must wait until 15 kilometers to do the gravity turn.
I still find that the Buran's reaction wheels and especially the RCS is unbalanced, when you yaw it wants to roll as well, when you are translating it rotates

Turn on SAS and let it fly itself, and allow it to wobble. Whne you reach 15 kilometers, roll the rocket so that you can gravity turn with the kliper being on its back. Be sure to activate RCS before starting your gravity turn, as it can otherwise result in much pain. No, you must wait until 15 kilometers to do the gravity turn.

i let it fly itself and it flips out at 5 KM and i lose control what am i missing? after i abort it i cant fly it and just flips around and i cant point it anywhere!

Edited December 8, 2013 by crasher925

I still find that the Buran's reaction wheels and especially the RCS is unbalanced, when you yaw it wants to roll as well, when you are translating it rotates

Read this thread or watch Youtube channel.

so i need to use mechjeb to fly it? ok im just trying to fly it without mechjeb if its possible...

Edited December 8, 2013 by crasher925
Should I try and re-install the robotic arms pack to stop it shaking the shuttle to bits?

Should I try and re-install the robotic arms pack to stop it shaking the shuttle to bits?

It will shake itself to bits anyway, that's the downside to the robotic arms.

if you move the arm slowly enough (AND by that I mean that you have Fine controll turned on, CAPSLOCK so that the pointers are BLUE)... it will never shake itself apart.

Q: But my shuttle DID shake itself apart, and I did everything you just said!

A: if you move the arm slowly enough ... SLOWLY

Still think this mod is awesome, always gonna have it

Finally finished it!!!

Edited December 9, 2013 by Cdodders
Updated Solar panels
*drooling* with every image/update you post! I am in love with the soyuz, especially iva.

Very nice textures. How much could it affect the RAM usage? I mean all of the new High resolution texture upgrade.

Edited December 9, 2013 by Reddragon

I'cant figure it out clear enough, but RAM usage is not depends on the model size in linear.

It is more important, how many details KSP is loading.

And his models are very large in MBs, but they are perfomance friendly enough.

I'm getting a large RAM usage when installing many plugins and parts only.

Very nice textures. How much could it affect the RAM usage? I mean all of the new High resolution texture upgrade.

All upgraded textures have same or lower quality.

First target this update great optimization.

All upgraded textures have same or lower quality.

First target this update great optimization.

That looks just about fantastic. I, and I believe I speak for most of this forum, really appreciate what you're doing.
Those new solar panels look awesome
